body.p: Assume that you are given a scatterplot that has a regression line of Y = 4.2 + (−2)X. Which of the following is the correct interpretation of the slope?

multiple_choice.choice: For each decrease of one unit in the explanatory variable (X), we expect the response variable (Y) to decrease by two units.
For each increase of one unit in the explanatory variable (X), we expect the response variable (Y) to increase by two units.
For each increase of one unit in the explanatory variable (X), we expect the response variable (Y) to change by 4.2 + (−2) = 2.2 units.
For each increase of one unit in the explanatory variable (X), we expect the response variable (Y) to decrease by two units.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The slope of this line is negative, since b = −2. This means that the two variables, X and Y, change inversely. In other words, if one increases, the other decreases, and vice versa.
Incorrect. The slope of this line is negative, since b = −2. This means that the two variables, X and Y, change inversely. In other words, if one increases, the other decreases, and vice versa.

Incorrect. You have predicted the value for the variable Y when X has a value of 1. This has nothing to do with an interpretation of slope. Slope describes how Y changes when Xx increases or decreases by a unit.

Correct. The slope of this line is negative, since b = −2. This means that the two variables, X and Y, change inversely. In other words, if one increases, the other decreases, and vice versa. In particular, as X changes by one unit, Y will inversely change by 2 units.
